rukus.text: The unbelievers’ say: "What! When we become dust— We and our fathers— Will we truly be raised (from the dead)
Indeed, we were promised this— We and our fathers before (us): These are nothing but the stories of the old
Say to them: "Travel through the earth and see what is the end of the criminals
But do not feel sad for them, and do not pain yourself because of their plots
And they say: "When will this promise (be true)? (Speak) if you are truthful
Say: "It can be that some of the events that you want hurried can be following (close to) you
But surely, your Lord is full of grace to mankind, still most of them show no gratitude
And surely, your Lord knows all that their hearts conceal, and all that they reveal
And there is nothing from the unseen, in heaven or earth, which is not (written) in a clear book (a record)
Surely, this Quran does explain to the children of Israel most of the things about which they disagree
And it certainly is a Guide and a Mercy to those who believe
Surely, your Lord will decide between them by His Order: And He is Supreme in Might (Aziz), All Knowing (Aleem)
So, (believers!) put your trust in Allah: Surely, you (O Prophet!) are on (the Path of) clear (and open) Truth
Truly, you cannot make the dead to hear, nor can make the deaf to hear the call, especially when they go away in hiding
Nor can you lead the blind, from wandering away (from the Path): You will get only those who believe in Our Signs to hear, and those who have submitted (to Allah as Muslims)
And (remember) when the Word is made true against them, We shall bring out from the earth a beast to (face) them: To speak to them, because mankind did not believe in Our Signs with (due) certainty
